messages.title: LABOUR’S TAX ON JOBS WILL KILL THE RECOVERY
messages.content: The re-election of Gordon Brown’s government - with more debt, waste and taxes - will bring us a new recession.

messages.title: BACKING THE NHS
messages.content: The NHS is our number one priority. We back it and we want to improve it for everyone.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Will cut Labour borrowing to stop the tax rise on jobs. Conservatives would take action to reduce the deficit.
Believes that under a Conservative government, people earning under £7,100 would not pay any income tax.
The NHS is the top priority, and Conservatives will increase spending on the NHS every year.
Mortgage payments lower under Labour and will reform the welfare system by getting people into jobs and cutting benefits for people who refuse to work.

issues.economy: Will cut Labour borrowing to stop tax rise on jobs.
issues.health: The NHS is our number one priority. We back it and we want to improve it for everyone.
issues.socialWelfare: Mortgage payments lower under Labour and will reform the welfare system by getting people into jobs and cutting benefits for people who refuse to work.

images.caption: David with Conservative Party Leader David Cameron.
David was one of many residents from across the constituency who supported the campaign to save our local post offices from Labour's closure programme.
In common with thousands of local families David opposes Labour's decision to close the Maternity, Dermatology and Ear, Nose and Throat Special Care Baby Unit at Fairfield.
David helped lead the Bury campaign against the congestion charge in the referendum Labour plans were decisively rejected by Bury and right across Greater Manchester.
